intro: Oxytropis cymbaecarpos, commonly known as the broadleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pale yellow to reddish-purple. It is native to the western United States and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Oxytropis cymbaecarpos is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils.
